isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - TEST INJECTION NOZZLES - Installation

important.para: IF COPPER GASKET IS NOT REMOVED WITH THE NOZZLE, USE A PIC TO REMOVE THE SEAL WASHER FROM THE NOZZLE BORE. DISCARD EACH SEAL WASHER AND REPLACE WITH NEW UPON REASSEMBLY. REFER TO FIGURE 5.41.

step1.para: Prior to installing the nozzles, clean the nozzle bores in the cylinder heads as follows:

step2.para: Thoroughly clean nozzle bore in cylinder head using nozzle seat cleaner, ZTSE-4139, before reinserting nozzle holder assembly. Pay particular attention to seating surfaces, in order that no small particles of carbon will cause assembly to be cocked or permit blow-by of combustion gases.
Clean injection nozzle seats in cylinder head (Figure 5.42), using nozzle seat cleaner ZTSE-4139 as follows:

step1.para: Insert the threaded sleeve of the nozzle seat cleaner, into the nozzle bore of the cylinder head as shown in Figure 5.42.
Use a 9/16 in. socket to turn the nozzle seat cleaner and remove any carbon build-up from the seat. Blow out with filtered compressed air.

figure.caption: Figure 5.42 Cleaning Nozzle Seats with ZTSE-4139

step1.para: Remove protective caps from nozzle tip and bore. Then install nozzle and holder assembly, with a new copper gasket, into the cylinder head nozzle bore.

caution.para: BE CAREFUL NOT TO STRIKE NOZZLE TIP AGAINST RECESS WALL DURING INSTALLATION.

step1.para: Tighten nozzle and holder assembly to 35 lbf-ft (47 Nm).
Remove protective covers from the fuel inlet end of the nozzle and from high pressure fuel lines.
Install two new O-ring seals on each nozzle holder body and install the leak-off lines and tees as an assembly after nozzle installation. Refer to Figures 5.43 thru 5.46 for fuel return line routing.

note.para: Install the line pressure sensor on the #4 cylinder nozzle, prior to injection pipe installation. Tighten the line pressure sensor to 28 lbf-ft. (38 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 5.43 S-SERIES Fuel Return Line Routing and Installation [All Except U-HAUL]
Figure 5.44 1000,3000 AND 4000 SERIES Fuel Return Line Routing and Installation [All Except U-HAUL]
Figure 5.45 EARLY MODEL Fuel Return Line Routing and Installation [U-HAUL Applications only]
Figure 5.46 LATE MODEL Fuel Return Line Routing and Installation [U-HAUL Applications only]

step1.para: Connect high pressure fuel pipes to nozzle. Tighten fuel pipe connector nut to 22 lbf-ft. (30 Nm) torque. Refer to Figure 5.47. Use fuel line nut wrench ZTSE-4133 to tighten the connector nuts to nozzles.
Purge high pressure fuel pipes of air by loosening connector and cranking engine until solid fuel (free from air) flows from connection. Retighten connection to specified torque.
Start engine and check for fuel leakage at high pressure connections and leak-off lines.

figure.caption: Figure 5.47 Installing High Pressure Fuel Pipes
